intro: Pyrenacantha malvifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered kraitgrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Pyrenacantha malvifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
